The Scientific Method for Startups by YC CEO Michael Seibel

"When people discuss startups they tend to talk about inspiration and creativity. This leads founders to believe they can imagineer a solution to any problem they’re trying to solve. In reality, executing a startup is a balance between creativity/intuition/instinct and the scientific method: hypothesize > a/b test > conclude > repeat."

http://blog.ycombinator.com/the-scientific-method-for-startups/ The Scientific Method for Startups Executing a startup is a balance between creativity/intuition/instinct and the scientific method: hypothesize > a/b test > conclude > repeat.

Request for Startups: Water

http://blog.ycombinator.com/request-for-startups-water/

We’re close to a tipping point where technology will let us make clean water extremely abundant and cheap. 

We’d love to help founders working on this problem get there faster. Ideas could range from lower-cost desalination plants, novel purification technologies, smart irrigation systems, mechanisms to reduce water usage, or something completely different.

We’re now reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so you can apply here now - http://www.ycombinator.com/apply/ Timeline Photos
